metadata.title: CVE-2021-47188 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: scsi:ufs: core: Improve SCSI abort handling The following has been observed on atest setup: WARNING: CPU: 4 PID: 250 at drivers/scsi/ufs/ufshcd.c:2737ufshcd_queuecommand+0x468/0x65c Call trace: ufshcd_queuecommand+0x468/0x65cscsi_send_eh_cmnd+0x224/0x6a0 scsi_eh_test_devices+0x248/0x418scsi_eh_ready_devs+0xc34/0xe58 scsi_error_handler+0x204/0x80ckthread+0x150/0x1b4 ret_from_fork+0x10/0x30 That warning is triggered bythe following statement: WARN_ON(lrbp->cmd); Fix this warning by clearinglrbp->cmd from the abort handler.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47188` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-generic - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-259-lowlatency - 4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-aws - 4.4.0-1136.142
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-259.293~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.142').
linux-azure package in trusty is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-1181.196~14.04.1').
